Helpers to search within a forest matrix

search_legal_entity.Rd

This function allows searching for parcels in a forest matrix based on owner names or location (lieu-dit).

Usage

search_legal_entity(x, prop = NULL, lieu_dit = NULL)

Arguments

x

data.frame; The matrix containing parcel legal entity information in a format readable by SEQUOIA.

prop

character; Owner name(s) used to further filter results. Defaults to NULL. Multiple owners can be specified.

lieu_dit

character; Locality name(s) used to further filter results. Defaults to NULL. Multiple locality names can be specified.

Value

A data.frame.

Details

The search relies on a text–normalization step applied to both the inputs and the corresponding columns of the matrice. This makes the search robust to accents, punctuation, spacing irregularities and case differences.

Examples of normalization:

  • "État / Forêts" → "ETATFORETS"

  • " Le Bois-de l'Orme " → "LEBOISDELORME"

  • "Société du Chêne" → "SOCIETEDUCHENE"

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
legal_entity <- get_legal_entity(29158)
search_mat <- search_legal_entity(legal_entity, c("penmarch", "guenole"))
} # }
